startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: *Knock knock knock*

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: You shove your hands awkwardly into the pockets of your jeans,

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: frantically trying to wipe off the sweat continually coating your palms.

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: Just one night. Just a meal! Just a little date.

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: Just your first ever date,

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: with a girl who may or may not want to tear into your throat.

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: Unfortunately, you're not into that.

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: It’s already 9:30.

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: Linda’s work only gives her an hour off for federally mandated lunch,

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: and she told you this was the only break in her schedule.

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: Honestly, you wonder how she’s even alive.

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: Even if she were undead,

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: when would she possibly have the time to mosquito it up?

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: But then again, vampires don’t typically ‘sleep’.

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: It would explain how she’s functioning.

startDialogue.Subject: Player
startDialogue.dialogueText: No use debating this.

startDialogue.Subject: Player
startDialogue.dialogueText: You’re here to figure this out, after all, and you need evidence.

startDialogue.Subject: Player
startDialogue.dialogueText: Right. Just prod as much as you can without weirding her out,

startDialogue.Subject: Player
startDialogue.dialogueText: and see if she slips up! This vampire investigation’ll be easy!

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: The door slowly creaks open.

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: A pair of dark eyes appear beyond the doorframe

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: before her startlingly sheet-white skin appears in the moonlight.

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: She looks put-together for maintaining consciousness

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: for upwards of 30 hours, which is to say, still standing.

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: Her professional, fashionable makeup

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: only manages to mostly disguise the deep circles under her eyes.

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: Meeting your gaze, she opens the door further.

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: This is not going to be easy.

startDialogue.Subject: Player
startDialogue.dialogueText: G-good evening, ma- I mean- Linda!

startDialogue.Subject: Linda
startDialogue.dialogueText: Hm.

startDialogue.Subject: Linda
startDialogue.dialogueText: On time. Good.

startDialogue.Subject: Linda
startDialogue.dialogueText: We’ve got 30 minutes until the restaurant closes.

startDialogue.Subject: Linda
startDialogue.dialogueText: I’ve got a 10:30, so let’s try to stay on schedule.

startDialogue.Subject: Narrator
startDialogue.dialogueText: She yawns, squinting into the moonlight as though it were blinding.

choices.Text: You look like you haven’t seen the sun in years.

startDialogue.Subject: Linda
startDialogue.dialogueText: Hm.

startDialogue.Subject: Linda
startDialogue.dialogueText: We’d best get moving.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Ah, Buccabellie’s. The one and only italian restaurant in town.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: You figured it was the most natural location to get these suspects close to garlic.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: You mentally apologize to the single server left in the restaurant, who you can feel glaring at you.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Linda sits opposite you, unbothered.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: You’ve got a plan. The garlic knot lasagna special.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: A horrifying monstrosity of carbohydrates, aggressively reeking of garlic. It’s your best shot.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Even the picture on the menu intimidates you.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Linda
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: So, have you brought your resume so that I can review it?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Player
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: …My resume?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Player
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: What for?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Linda
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: First dates typically involve finding common ground, yes?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Linda
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: How many years of work experience do you have?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Player
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Uh… I had a summer job at the grocery store.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Linda
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Retail? That’s workable. Do you find mindless work satisfying?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Player
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Excuse me?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Linda
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: What would you say is your greatest strength?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Player
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Uh, a keen eye for details?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: For a moment, Linda’s hand rises to her mouth, as if on instinct.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Linda
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Interesting.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: The waiter, with barely restrained frustration, stops by the table. It’s time for phase two.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: The biggest item on the menu, 25 minutes before closing.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: You can feel the back of your head beginning to melt from the glare.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: You can feel the back of your head beginning to melt from the glare.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Linda
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: I don’t think I have any more questions. What about you?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Shit. Shit shit shit. How do you continue a conversation?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Player
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Um. What about– your hobbies? What do you do in your free time?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Linda
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Stare at walls. Sleep.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Player
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Um… What’s work like?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Linda
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: I’ve been staring at spreadsheets for 36 hours.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Linda
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: I can’t say it’s a particularly thrilling topic of conversation.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: The food arrives.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Linda pokes hesitantly at the mild plate of pasta before her. Is she too tired to eat?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: You stare down at your own plate of food. It's horrifying.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: The heaping lasagna, most likely containing an evening’s worth of spit from your server,

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: The sight of the food is overwhelming, and the stench of garlic visibly wafts into the air.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Linda
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: ACHOO!

walkingDialogue.Subject: Player
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Ha… Ha ha… Mmmm!

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: You shovel a spoonful of the heaving mass into your mouth. You swallow it like a pill, as fast as possible.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: You consider expelling all that food in the desperate prayer that it might just cover that stench.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: The bill is served with your food. They want you out of there.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Linda
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: The service here is fast.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Player
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: It’s special, for us.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Oh god. It’s already almost over.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Your stress spikes as you simultaneously exhale. Fuck.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Is this where it’s going to end? You feel like you’ve gotten nowhere with her.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Do you feel remotely certain yet?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: Is there any way you can extend this?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Player
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: H-hey! Do you have somewhere to be?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Linda
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: …Home. For work. Although I’ve got to run an errand.

walkingDialogue.Subject: Player
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: I-I’ll go with you! I’ve got, uh, all the time in the world?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Narrator
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: What the fuck are you doing. Is she glaring at you?

walkingDialogue.Subject: Linda
walkingDialogue.dialogueText: If you… insist.

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Narrator
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: The silence is deafening as you make the 15 minute stroll to the pharmacy.

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Narrator
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: She walks quickly, with purpose– you struggle to keep up with her pace.

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Linda
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: Lovely weather, we’re having. Yes?

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Player
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: It’s pitch black out?

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Linda
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: I consider that good weather.

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Player
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: Haha... ha.

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Narrator
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: What the hell are you even doing at this point? Fuck it.

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Narrator
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: You finally reach the little 24/7 corner store just around the bend from Linda’s apartment.

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Narrator
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: The shelves are claustrophobically close,

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Narrator
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: and one teenage cashier sits at the counter, barely conscious.

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Player
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: Soooo…. What’s this little trip for?

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Linda
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: Gauze. First aid.

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Narrator
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: How’s she getting injured at a desk job?

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Narrator
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: Linda looks over to the single cashier.

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Player
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: …Thinking about them?

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Player
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: Do you relate?

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Linda
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: …Nobody works for fun.

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Linda
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: They look– so young.

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Linda
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: I don’t know. I just, well, wish I could do something to help.

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Linda
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: Something to help change their circumstances. Something to–

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Linda
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: Well, shopping this late might not be helping, ha.

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Narrator
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: You walk back to her apartment in the dark. You’re alone.

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Narrator
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: The hairs on your neck won’t settle.

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Narrator
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: You feel your skin crawl, your eyes unable to keep from darting to her every couple of steps.

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Narrator
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: She wouldn’t attack you after all this, would she?

restaurantDialogue.Subject: Narrator
restaurantDialogue.dialogueText: Thankfully, the trip is fast. You reach her doorway…

endDialogue.Subject: Linda
endDialogue.dialogueText: It’s rare I get a chance to… Just spend time with someone, my age.

endDialogue.Subject: Linda
endDialogue.dialogueText: It was more enjoyable than I expected.

endDialogue.Subject: Linda
endDialogue.dialogueText: I’ll see you around, alright? Bye.
